result.execSummary:
The defendant Sunshine K Ketchum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.
Concurrent with: count 1 in 13CF1258

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law. 
If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
**AMENDED 8/4/2016 DNA FEE IS WAIVED.**
Obtain GED or HSED. Obtain job skills. Obtain and maintain fulltime employment once released.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Maintain recovery program. Comply with the terms of the family court order. No contact with J.M., G.S., A.M., OR R.P. (person, property, residence or family). Once released live in a sober living facility for 6 months. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Firearm warning given. Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Concurrent with: count 1 in 13CF1258

Defendant Sunshine K Ketchum in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Defendant Sunshine K Ketchum in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Christopher Glinski
Preliminary hearing on July 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Sunshine K Ketchum in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Sunshine K Ketchum in custody.  Lillian V. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
BTC: Vacate Warrant
